protocol_name: Bioinformatic analysis of biomarker genes using metagenomic shotgun sequence datasets
protocol_name_html: Bioinformatic analysis of biomarker genes using metagenomic shotgun sequence datasets
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"emeeg","text":"This protocol describes the steps used to analyze shotgun sequences deposited in in Integrated Microbial Genomes and Microbiomes (IMG/M ) by using functional anotation evidences. KEGG orthology terms and pathways  are used as evidence.The abundance of each of the corresponding biomarker genes is estimated by calculating the proportion of amino acid sequences assigned to the KO of interest (estimated gene copies, assembled and unassembled metagenomes, as retrieved from IMG/M) and normalized with respect to the total number of sequences assigned to KOs in each metagenome.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":130,"length":5,"key":0},{"offset":179,"length":33,"key":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E6D6B2C0C28111E897CBDDAE480D334F","url":"https://img.jgi.doe.gov/"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"20CEC940C28211E897CBDDAE480D334F","url":"https://www.genome.jp/kegg/ko.html"}}}}

fork_info.protocol_name: Bioinformatic analysis of biomarker genes using metagenomic shotgun sequence datasets
fork_info.protocol_name_html: Bioinformatic analysis of biomarker genes using metagenomic shotgun sequence datasets

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"cjq4i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2thvd","text":" Dataset\nIntegrated Microbial Genomes and Microbiomes\n","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"9iqss","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2vfpl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"foep8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"fhc7m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"be6ga","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":2}],"data":[]},{"key":"1a6da","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"34tif","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"dataset","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":191,"guid":"037D4E30C28611E897CBDDAE480D334F","align":null,"name":"Integrated Microbial Genomes and Microbiomes","link":"https:\/\/img.jgi.doe.gov","can_edit":true,"step_guid":"58527D00C28511E897CBDDAE480D334F","affiliation":null}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"6hleu","text":"To select metagenome(s) of interest, click on the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cbl6r","text":"Find Genomes -> Genome Search -> Quick Search with \"Search Parameters: Search by ID \",  and paste ID(s) in the corresponding box, separated by commas. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1mamq","text":"In our case, we searched by IDs: 3300000122, 3300000242, 3300000118, 3300000121, 3300000131, 3300000125","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"332jt","text":"Select the boxes on the retrieved genomes, and click \"Add selected to Genome Cart\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8b7fl","text":"With the genomes added to the genome cart it is possible to export them listed in an excel file. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2fgpe","text":"Once the genomes have been selected and added to the genome cart all the tools present in the IMG website are available for different analyses. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"388be","text":"In all cases be sure that the analyses were performed on your dataset. For that, check in the superior bar below the JGI\/IMG icon where your data is depicted as \"My Analysis Carts\". It is important that the genomes number  is in agreement with the genomes that have been selected. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a8ggl","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"EB7F643E31D74C9F9F14AE103DC41F12","id":677416,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Find metagenomes in the database"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9jn0r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3tsp8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"40i9n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"8f7dg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"hjjt","text":"To obtain the KO table from the database:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dlv7g","text":"Go to the menu and select the Compare Genomes item and then Abundance Profiles. Finally click on Overview (all functions) item where you will determinate several features of the KO table settings different options.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8lrv7","text":"Toggle the option Matrix and then for normalization method chose the Genome count (estimated gene copies). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"20ekb","text":"As functional profile of the dataset could be represents using different database for functional evidence, to get KO table based based on KEGG database, set the KO option for the Function item.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"n9ub","text":"The source for searching will be the metagenomes previously selected. Prior to consider the total secuence annoted as metagenomes those sequences included in the assembled as the unassembled fraction must be selected.For that puropose in the Genome option set both (assembled and unassembled) and  all finished, permanent draft and draft for  MER-FS Metagenome and Sequencing status items respectively. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1l9i1","text":"Finally press Go. A new screen will be appeared  where the option for download the KO table will be shown. Finally select for Download tab-delimted file for Excel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8n02p","text":"     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"35gcg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"71a3e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"4B03E89D7377450DA397E1313867C95B","id":673067,"previous_id":673066,"previous_guid":"42E1A140D95911E88899E1FCCC996040","section":"Get the KO table from the database"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6lhpt","text":"Build a normalized table: divide each KO abundance in each metagenome by the number of  sequences assigned to KOs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9sc4j","text":"As the exported table from the IMG displays the KO therms in rows and  samples columns in order to normalize the sequence abundance the total sequence count per sample should be obtained. For that, a sum function for total sum per column would be useful to get the sum of every KO therm count in every sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fkmvm","text":"For normalization, each KO therm count wil be devided by the total sequence count per sample. This procedure has to be applied for every sample in all dataset.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"42E1A140D95911E88899E1FCCC996040","id":677319,"previous_id":673067,"previous_guid":"821825EDBEA84F77A9EDB1259F0A7181","section":"Get the KO table from the database"}
steps.section: Get the KO table from the database
